body:
On Windows, `bash` in PATH may point to WSL's bash.exe (in C:\Windows\System32) which:
1. Doesn't work with Windows filesystem paths  
2. Errors out asking you to install a WSL distribution

v0.23.1 tried to fix this by hardcoding Git Bash path, but that broke systems without Git Bash.

v0.23.2 fix: Use OnceLock to cache bash detection. Try `bash -c 'echo ok'` first - if it returns 'ok', use PATH bash. Otherwise fall back to Git Bash at C:\Program Files\Git\bin\bash.exe.

Added test/windows/bash.txt to verify bash works on Windows CI.
title: Windows bash detection: WSL vs Git Bash
